messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Gohatto and UK release dates.
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry to bring up a old issue. I recently bought this  movie gohatto from hong kong and was expecting some great fight scenes.  While the fight scenes in this
messages.messageBody:
Sorry to bring up a old issue.

I recently bought this movie gohatto from hong kong
and was expecting some great fight scenes. While the
fight scenes in this movie are good there are not alot
of them. The story was very good and I was not
disapointed but just thought I would give the heads up
to those interested

Musashi

--- fifthchamber@... wrote:
> I also think that Gohatto is definately one of the
> best Japanese Samurai
> films that I have ever seen and cannot recommend it
> enough. The scenery and
> the acting are incredibly beautiful, from Kitano's
> roughened old Bushi
> through to the final Sakura (cherry blossom) and the
> way that it is lit for
> the final scenes...
> The question that I have is wether anyone out there
> has heard of any release
> dates for the film on (region 2-PAL, UK playable)
> DVD yet? I am aware that it
> has been offered already on Amazon etc. but have not
> heard anything about
> it's UK release dates....Till then.
> Abayo....Ben Sharples.
>

messages.subject: Gohatto and UK release dates.
messages.msgSnippet: I also think that Gohatto is definately one of the best Japanese Samurai films that I have ever seen and cannot recommend it enough. The scenery and the acting
messages.messageBody:
I also think that Gohatto is definately one of the best Japanese Samurai
films that I have ever seen and cannot recommend it enough. The scenery and
the acting are incredibly beautiful, from Kitano's roughened old Bushi
through to the final Sakura (cherry blossom) and the way that it is lit for
the final scenes...
The question that I have is wether anyone out there has heard of any release
dates for the film on (region 2-PAL, UK playable) DVD yet? I am aware that it
has been offered already on Amazon etc. but have not heard anything about
it's UK release dates....Till then.
Abayo....Ben Sharples.
